alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 6:09PM PDT until July 27 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Nevada and southern Nevada, including the following counties, in south central Nevada, Lincoln. In southern Nevada, Clark. * WHEN...Until 915 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 609 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms across southeastern Lincoln county and northeastern Clark counties. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area which includes Mesquite and the Moapa-Overton areas. Between 0.25 and 1 inch of rain has fallen or is expected to fall shortly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mesquite, Moapa Town, Overton, Moapa Valley, Logandale, Bunkerville, Overton Beach, Valley Of Fire, Sr 168 Mile Marker 21 and Carp. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
